summary: This is an internal FBI email from August 6, 2019, discussing logistical planning for a search warrant execution at Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas. The email indicates the Southern District of New York (SDNY) is drafting the affidavit, with plans to fly FBI personnel to the island on August 11, 2019, to conduct a search expected to last 1-3 days.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: Author of the initial email planning the logistics for the FBI search of Epstein's island. Identified as SSA of Squad C-20, which handles Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking at the FBI New York office.

events.title: Search Warrant Sworn Out in St. Thomas
events.description: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) is drafting a search warrant affidavit for Epstein's island, with the expectation the warrant will be sworn out in St. Thomas.

events.title: FBI Team Travels to Epstein's Island
events.description: Planned departure for FBI personnel on the FBI Q400 plane to travel to Epstein's private island off St. Thomas to execute the search warrant.

events.title: Search of Epstein's Island
events.description: The planned search of Epstein's island, managed by the FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT), is expected to take 1-3 days.

events.title: FBI Team Travels Home
events.description: The tentative travel day home for the FBI team following the search of Epstein's island.

keyFacts: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) was actively drafting a search warrant affidavit for Jeffrey Epstein's private island in August 2019.
The FBI planned to execute the search warrant using its Evidence Response Team (ERT), with the operation expected to last 1-3 days.
Logistical planning involved the FBI's Q400 plane for transportation to and from the island, indicating the scale and official nature of the operation.
The email confirms active federal investigation into Epstein's activities on his private island shortly before his death in August 2019.
The FBI squad involved was Squad C-20, specializing in Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking.
